Converter¶

Ego2Tensor Class¶

class graph2tensor.converter.Ego2Tensor(graph, include_edge=False)¶

An object that convert ego-graph into tensor.

Parameters

  • graph – the graph to lookup nodes & edges attributes

  • include_edge – whether or not lookup edges attributes, if not, the src_ids and dst_ids will be put into hop as a np.ndarray with shape (num, 2)

convert(egograph: graph2tensor.egograph.egograph.EgoGraph, **kwargs) → Tuple[Tuple[Tuple[Dict[str, numpy.ndarray], Union[Dict[str, numpy.ndarray], numpy.ndarray], Dict[str, numpy.ndarray], numpy.ndarray], ...], ...]¶

Fetch weight & attributes of nodes and edges in ego-graph and convert the ego-graph into format that could be feed into tensorflow

Parameters

egograph – graph2tensor.egograph.EgoGraph object

Returns

A tuple representation of sub-graph as (path#1, path#2, …, path#N). path#N is a tuple, representing a path in ego-graph, whose element – hop is triplet as (src, edge, dst, offset) and src/edge/dst is a dict with “weight” or attribute name as key and weight or attribute in numpy.ndarray format as value if include_edge set True, otherwise edge will be an empty numpy.ndarray, offset is the offset for src, edge and dst.

e.g.

(
    # path#1
    ((src, edge, dst, offset), #hop#1
    (src, edge, dst, offset),  #hop#2
    (src, edge, dst, offset)), #hop#3
    # path#2
    ((src, edge, dst, offset), #hop#1
    (src, edge, dst, offset),  #hop#2
    (src, edge, dst, offset)), #hop#3
    # path#N
    ...
)

SkipGram Class¶

class graph2tensor.converter.SkipGram(vocabulary_size, window_size=5, negative_samples=5, sampling_table=None)¶

A converter which generate skip-grams (and negative samples) from paths.

Parameters

  • vocabulary_size – total numbers of nodes

  • window_size – the window size of skip-gram

  • negative_samples – how many negative nodes to sample for each target node

  • sampling_table – 1-d np.ndarray with length vocabulary_size, the distribution for negative sampling

convert(paths, **kwargs)¶

Generate skip-gram (and negative samples) from paths.

Parameters

paths – paths to generate skip-gram from

Returns

(target, context, labels), target is 1-d np.ndarray, context is 2-d np.ndarray with shape (num_target, negative_samples+1) and labels is 2-d np.ndarray with same shape as context in which 1-value indicate skip-gram, 0-value indicate negative nodes, thus, there exists only one 1-value in each row of labels.
